newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Ringgit up on speculative buying ahead of budget.
newsitem.headline: Ringgit up on speculative buying ahead of budget.

text.p: The ringgit gained further in late Asian afternoon trading on fresh speculative support ahead of the country's annual budget on Friday, dealers said.
They said some in the market viewed the upcoming budget as being positive for the ringgit.

"Some people say the budget will be stimulatory for the economy, which is difficult to believe because the country has just about managed to contain overheating pressures," a dealer with a foreign bank in Kuala Lumpur said.
He said today the ringgit was also helped by profit-taking in dollar/majors after days of sharp gains.
Many dealers said the ringgit would trade in a 2.5040/5100 range in the next few days.
They said dollar/ringgit would head higher after an initial reaction to the budget.
"It is difficult to justify the current strength of the ringgit in the face of a rising dollar/majors," a Malaysian bank dealer said.
At 0900 GMT, the ringgit was at 2.5046/56 a dollar against 2.5063.70 at close of Kuala Lumpur on Monday. The Singapore dollar was at 0.5644/50 a ringgit against 0.5641/46.
